com.ibm.team.scm.client
Interface IConnection

All Superinterfaces:
IEventSource
All Known Subinterfaces:
IBaselineConnection, IFlowNodeConnection, IWorkspaceConnection
public interface IConnection
extends IEventSource

Interface providing common protocol for managing a connection to carry on an extended interaction with a target (workspace, stream or baseline) stored in a repository.

Connections are intended to be used by multi-threaded clients. Unless noted, the methods on IConnection and can be safely called from multiple threads concurrently without risk of corruption.

Each connection is permanently associated with a single repository ( IConnection.teamRepository()). A connection is valid and usable while the repository is logged in to.

Since:
0.5

sameRepository

boolean sameRepository(IConnection other)
Determines whether or not the repositories associated to two connections are the same repository.

Parameters:
other - the other connection, cannot be null
Returns:
true if the repositories are the same, false otherwise.

hasChangeSets

boolean hasChangeSets(java.util.List changeSets,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                      throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns whether or not all of the listed change sets are present in this target's change history (flow node or baseline).

If the client is not logged in to the repository, the operation throws NotLoggedInException.

Parameters:
changeSets - the list of change sets to look up (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
true if all items on the list of change sets are present in the target's change history; false otherwise
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the target has been deleted out from under the IConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

changeSetsInHistory

java.util.List changeSetsInHistory(java.util.List changeSets,
                                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                   throws TeamRepositoryException
Returns the subset of the listed change sets that are present in this target's change history (flow node or baseline).

If the client is not logged in to the repository, the operation throws NotLoggedInException.

Parameters:
changeSets - the list of change sets to look up (element type: IChangeSetHandle); must not contain duplicates; must not be null
monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
Returns:
the subset of the list of given change sets that are present in the flow node's change history; never null
Throws:
NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
ItemNotFoundException - if the operation fails because the target has been deleted out from under the IConnection
TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason

                               com.ibm.team.scm.common.dto.IPermissionContextProvider contextProvider,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
Set the permissions for the given versionables and their descendants in the given component for this connection.

componentHandle - the component
contextProvider - the permissions context

Throws:
